member.name: T:Assimp.MemoryHelper
member.summary: Helper static class containing functions that aid dealing with unmanaged memory to managed memory conversions.

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.ToNativeArray``2(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{``0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marshals an array of managed values to a c-style unmanaged array (void*). This also can optionally marshal to an unmanaged array of pointers (void**).
member.param: True if the pointer is an array of pointers, false otherwise.
member.returns: Pointer to unmanaged memory

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.FromNativeArray``2(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marshals an array of managed values from a c-style unmanaged array (void*). This also can optionally marshal from an unmanaged array of pointers (void**).
member.param: True if the pointer is an array of pointers, false otherwise.
member.returns: Marshaled managed values

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.ToNativeArray``1(``0[])
member.summary: Marshals an array of blittable structs to a c-style unmanaged array (void*). This should not be used on non-blittable types that require marshaling by the runtime (e.g. has MarshalAs attributes).
member.returns: Pointer to unmanaged memory

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.ToNativeArray``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0})
member.summary: Marshals a list of blittable structs to a c-style unmanaged array (void*). This should not be used on non-blittable types that require marshaling by the runtime (e.g. has MarshalAs attributes).
member.returns: Pointer to unmanaged memory

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.FromNativeArray``1(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Marshals an array of blittable structs from a c-style unmanaged array (void*). This should not be used on non-blittable types that require marshaling by the runtime (e.g. has MarshalAs attributes).
member.returns: Managed array

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.FreeNativeArray``1(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,Assimp.FreeNativeDelegate,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Frees an unmanaged array and performs cleanup for each value. Optionally can free an array of pointers. This can be used on any type that can be marshaled into unmanaged memory.
member.param: Delegate that performs the necessary cleanup
True if the pointer is an array of pointers, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.ToNativePointer``2(``0)
member.summary: Marshals a managed value to unmanaged memory.
member.returns: Pointer to unmanaged memory

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.FromNativePointer``2(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Marshals a managed value from unmanaged memory.
member.returns: The marshaled managed value

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.MarshalStructure``1(System.IntPtr,``0@)
member.summary: Convienence method for marshaling a pointer to a structure. Only use if the type is not blittable, otherwise use the read methods for blittable types.

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.MarshalStructure``1(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Convienence method for marshaling a pointer to a structure. Only use if the type is not blittable, otherwise use the read methods for blittable types.
member.returns: The marshaled structure

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.MarshalPointer``1(``0@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Convienence method for marshaling a structure to a pointer. Only use if the type is not blittable, otherwise use the write methods for blittable types.
member.param: Pointer to unmanaged chunk of memory which must be allocated prior to this call

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.MarshalSizeOf``1
member.summary: Computes the size of the struct type using Marshal SizeOf. Only use if the type is not blittable, thus requiring marshaling by the runtime, (e.g. has MarshalAs attributes), otherwise use the SizeOf methods for blittable types.
member.returns: Size of the struct in bytes.

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.AllocateMemory(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocates unmanaged memory. This memory should only be freed by this helper.

member.returns: Pointer to the allocated unmanaged memory.

member.name: M:Assimp.MemoryHelper.FreeMemory(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Frees unmanaged memory that was allocated by this helper.

member.name: T:Assimp.Mesh
member.summary: A mesh represents geometry with a single material.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the mesh name. This tends to be used when formats name nodes and meshes independently, vertex animations refer to meshes by their names, or importers split meshes up, each mesh will reference the same (dummy) name.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.PrimitiveType
member.summary: Gets or sets the primitive type. This may contain more than one type unless if option is not set.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.MaterialIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the material associated with this mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.VertexCount
member.summary: Gets the number of vertices in this mesh. This is the count that all per-vertex lists should be the size of.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.HasVertices
member.summary: Gets if the mesh has a vertex array. This should always return true provided no special scene flags are set.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.Vertices
member.summary: Gets the vertex position list.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.HasNormals
member.summary: Gets if the mesh as normals. If it does exist, the count should be the same as the vertex count.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.Normals
member.summary: Gets the vertex normal list.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.HasTangentBasis
member.summary: Gets if the mesh has tangents and bitangents. It is not possible for one to be without the other. If it does exist, the count should be the same as the vertex count.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.Tangents
member.summary: Gets the vertex tangent list.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.BiTangents
member.summary: Gets the vertex bitangent list.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.FaceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of faces contained in the mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.HasFaces
member.summary: Gets if the mesh contains faces. If no special scene flags are set, this should always return true.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.Faces
member.summary: Gets the mesh's faces. Each face will contain indices to the vertices.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.VertexColorChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of valid vertex color channels contained in the mesh (list is not empty/not null). This can be a value between zero and the maximum vertex color count. Each individual channel should be the size of .

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.TextureCoordinateChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of valid texture coordinate channels contained in the mesh (list is not empty/not null). This can be a value between zero and the maximum texture coordinate count. Each individual channel should be the size of .

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.VertexColorChannels
member.summary: Gets the array that contains each vertex color channels, by default all are lists of zero (but can be set to null). Each index in the array corresponds to the texture coordinate channel. The length of the array corresponds to Assimp's maximum vertex color channel limit.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.TextureCoordinateChannels
member.summary: Gets the array that contains each texture coordinate channel, by default all are lists of zero (but can be set to null). Each index in the array corresponds to the texture coordinate channel. The length of the array corresponds to Assimp's maximum UV channel limit.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.UVComponentCount
member.summary: Gets the array that contains the count of UV(W) components for each texture coordinate channel, usually 2 (UV) or 3 (UVW). A component value of zero means the texture coordinate channel does not exist. The channel index (index in the array) corresponds to the texture coordinate channel index.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.BoneCount
member.summary: Gets the number of bones that influence this mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.HasBones
member.summary: Gets if this mesh has bones.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.Bones
member.summary: Gets the bones that influence this mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.MeshAnimationAttachmentCount
member.summary: Gets the number of mesh animation attachments that influence this mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.HasMeshAnimationAttachments
member.summary: Gets if this mesh has mesh animation attachments.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.MeshAnimationAttachments
member.summary: Gets the mesh animation attachments that influence this mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.MorphMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the morph method used when animation attachments are used.

member.name: P:Assimp.Mesh.BoundingBox
member.summary: Gets or sets the axis aligned bounding box that contains the extents of the mesh.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.
member.param: Primitive types contained in the mesh.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.
member.param: Primitive types contained in the mesh.

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.HasVertexColors(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the mesh has vertex colors for the specified channel. This returns false if the list is null or empty. The channel, if it exists, should contain the same number of entries as .
member.returns: True if vertex colors are present in the channel.

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.HasTextureCoords(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the mesh has texture coordinates for the specified channel. This returns false if the list is null or empty. The channel, if it exists, should contain the same number of entries as .
member.returns: True if texture coordinates are present in the channel.

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.SetIndices(System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Convienence method for setting this meshe's face list from an index buffer.
member.returns: True if the operation succeeded, false otherwise (e.g. not enough data)

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.GetIndices
member.summary: Convenience method for accumulating all face indices into a single index array.
member.returns: int index array

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.GetUnsignedIndices
member.summary: Convenience method for accumulating all face indices into a single index array as unsigned integers (the default from Assimp, if you need them).
member.returns: uint index enumerable

member.name: M:Assimp.Mesh.GetShortIndices
member.summary: Convenience method for accumulating all face indices into a single index array.
member.returns: short index enumerable

member.name: T:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment
member.summary: A mesh attachment store per-vertex animations for a particular frame. You may think of this as a 'patch' for the host mesh, since the mesh attachment replaces only certain vertex data streams at a particular time. Each mesh stores 'n' attached meshes. The actual relationship between the time line and mesh attachments is established by the mesh animation channel, which references singular mesh attachments by their ID and binds them to a time offset.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the mesh animation name.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.VertexCount
member.summary: Gets the number of vertices in this mesh. This is a replacement for the host mesh's vertex count. Likewise, a mesh attachment cannot add or remove per-vertex attributes, therefore the existance of vertex data will match the existance of data in the mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.HasVertices
member.summary: Checks whether the attachment mesh overrides the vertex positions of its host mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.Vertices
member.summary: Gets the vertex position list.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.HasNormals
member.summary: Checks whether the attachment mesh overrides the vertex normals of its host mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.Normals
member.summary: Gets the vertex normal list.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.HasTangentBasis
member.summary: Checks whether the attachment mesh overrides the vertex tangents and bitangents of its host mesh.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.Tangents
member.summary: Gets the vertex tangent list.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.BiTangents
member.summary: Gets the vertex bitangent list.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.VertexColorChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of valid vertex color channels contained in the mesh (list is not empty/not null). This can be a value between zero and the maximum vertex color count. Each individual channel should be the size of .

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.TextureCoordinateChannelCount
member.summary: Gets the number of valid texture coordinate channels contained in the mesh (list is not empty/not null). This can be a value between zero and the maximum texture coordinate count. Each individual channel should be the size of .

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.VertexColorChannels
member.summary: Gets the array that contains each vertex color channels that override a specific channel in the host mesh, by default all are lists of zero (but can be set to null). Each index in the array corresponds to the texture coordinate channel. The length of the array corresponds to Assimp's maximum vertex color channel limit.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.TextureCoordinateChannels
member.summary: Gets the array that contains each texture coordinate channel that override a specific channel in the host mesh, by default all are lists of zero (but can be set to null). Each index in the array corresponds to the texture coordinate channel. The length of the array corresponds to Assimp's maximum UV channel limit.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight of the mesh animation.

member.name: M:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.HasVertexColors(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the mesh attachment overrides a particular set of vertex colors on the host mesh. This returns false if the list is null or empty. The index is between zero and the maximumb number of vertex color channels.
member.returns: True if vertex colors are present in the channel.

member.name: M:Assimp.MeshAnimationAttachment.HasTextureCoords(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if the mesh attachment overrides a particular set of texture coordinates on the host mesh. This returns false if the list is null or empty. The index is between zero and the maximum number of texture coordinate channels.
member.returns: True if texture coordinates are present in the channel.

member.summary: Gets if the native value type is blittable (that is, does not require marshaling by the runtime, e.g. has MarshalAs attributes).

member.summary: Reads the unmanaged data from the native value.

member.summary: Frees unmanaged memory created by .
member.param: True if the unmanaged memory should be freed, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Assimp.MeshAnimationChannel
member.summary: Describes vertex-based animations for a single mesh or a group of meshes. Meshes carry the animation data for each frame. The purpose of this object is to define keyframes, linking each mesh attachment to a particular point in a time.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationChannel.MeshName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the mesh to be animated. Empty strings are not allowed, animation meshes need to be named (not necessarily uniquely, the name can basically serve as a wildcard to select a group of meshes with similar animation setup).

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationChannel.MeshKeyCount
member.summary: Gets the number of meshkeys in this animation channel. There will always be at least one key.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationChannel.HasMeshKeys
member.summary: Gets if this animation channel has mesh keys - this should always be true.

member.name: P:Assimp.MeshAnimationChannel.MeshKeys
member.summary: Gets the mesh keyframes of the animation. This should not be null.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

member.param: Optional pointer to the memory that will hold the native value.

member.summary: Reads the unmanaged data from the native value.

member.summary: Frees unmanaged memory created by .
member.param: True if the unmanaged memory should be freed, false otherwise.

member.name: T:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel
member.summary:
Describes the animation of a single node. The name specifies the bone/node which is affected by this animation chanenl. The keyframes are given in three separate seties of values, one for each position, rotation, and scaling. The transformation matrix is computed from these values and replaces the node's original transformation matrix at a specific time.
This means all keys are absolute and not relative to the bone default pose. The order which the transformations are to be applied is scaling, rotation, and translation (SRT).
Keys are in chronological order and duplicate keys do not pass the validation step. There most likely will be no negative time values, but they are not forbidden.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.NodeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the node affected by this animation. It must exist and it must be unique.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.PositionKeyCount
member.summary: Gets the number of position keys in the animation channel.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.HasPositionKeys
member.summary: Gets if this animation channel contains position keys.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.PositionKeys
member.summary: Gets the position keys of this animation channel. Positions are specified as a 3D vector. If there are position keys, there should also be -at least- one scaling and one rotation key.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.RotationKeyCount
member.summary: Gets the number of rotation keys in the animation channel.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.HasRotationKeys
member.summary: Gets if the animation channel contains rotation keys.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.RotationKeys
member.summary: Gets the rotation keys of this animation channel. Rotations are given as quaternions. If this exists, there should be -at least- one scaling and one position key.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.ScalingKeyCount
member.summary: Gets the number of scaling keys in the animation channel.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.HasScalingKeys
member.summary: Gets if the animation channel contains scaling keys.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.ScalingKeys
member.summary: Gets the scaling keys of this animation channel. Scalings are specified in a 3D vector. If there are scaling keys, there should also be -at least- one position and one rotation key.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.PreState
member.summary: Gets or sets how the animation behaves before the first key is encountered. By default the original transformation matrix of the affected node is used.

member.name: P:Assimp.NodeAnimationChannel.PostState
member.summary: Gets or sets how the animation behaves after the last key was processed. By default the original transformation matrix of the affected node is taken.

member.name: T:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs
member.summary: Defines configurable properties for importing models. All properties have default values. Setting config properties are done via the SetProperty* methods in AssimpMethods.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_GLOB_MEASURE_TIME
member.summary:
Enables time measurements. If enabled the time needed for each part of the loading process is timed and logged.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_GLOB_MULTITHREADING
member.summary:
Sets Assimp's multithreading policy. This is ignored if Assimp is built without boost.thread support. Possible values are: -1 to let Assimp decide, 0 to disable multithreading, and nay number larger than 0 to force a specific number of threads. This is only a hint and may be ignored by Assimp.
Type: integer. Default: -1

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_NO_SKELETON_MESHES
member.summary:
Global setting to disable generation of skeleton dummy meshes. These are generated as a visualization aid in cases which the input data contains no geometry, but only animation data. So the geometry are visualizing the bones.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_CT_MAX_SMOOTHING_ANGLE
member.summary:
Specifies the maximum angle that may be between two vertex tangents that their tangents and bitangents are smoothed during the step to calculate the tangent basis. The angle specified is in degrees. The maximum value is 175 degrees.
Type: float. Default: 45 degrees

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_GSN_MAX_SMOOTHING_ANGLE
member.summary:
Specifies the maximum angle that may be between two face normals at the same vertex position that their normals will be smoothed together during the calculate smooth normals step. This is commonly called the "crease angle". The angle is specified in degrees. Maximum value is 175 degrees (all vertices smoothed).
Type: float. Default: 175 degrees

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_MDL_COLORMAP
member.summary:
Sets the colormap(= palette) to be used to decode embedded textures in MDL (Quake or 3DG5) files. This must be a valid path to a file. The file is 768 (256 * 3) bytes large and contains RGB triplets for each of the 256 palette entries. If the file is not found, a default palette (from Quake 1) is used.
Type: string. Default: "colormap.lmp"

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_RRM_EXCLUDE_LIST
member.summary:
Configures the step to keep materials matching a name in a given list. This is a list of 1 to n strings where whitespace ' ' serves as a delimiter character. Identifiers containing whitespaces must be enclosed in *single* quotation marks. Tabs or carriage returns are treated as whitespace.
If a material matches one of these names, it will not be modified or removed by the post processing step nor will other materials be replaced by a reference to it.
Default: string. Default: ""

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_PTV_KEEP_HIERARCHY
member.summary:
Configures the step to keep the scene hierarchy. Meshes are moved to worldspace, but no optimization is performed where meshes with the same materials are not joined.
This option could be of used if you have a scene hierarchy that contains important additional information which you intend to parse.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_PTV_NORMALIZE
member.summary:
Configures the step to normalize all vertex components into the -1...1 range. That is, a bounding box for the whole scene is computed where the maximum component is taken and all meshes are scaled uniformly. This is useful if you don't know the spatial dimension of the input data.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_FD_REMOVE
member.summary:
Configures the step to remove degenerated primitives from the import immediately.
The default behavior converts degenerated triangles to lines and degenerated lines to points.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_FD_CHECKAREA
member.summary:
Configures the step to check the area of a triangle to be greater than 1e-6. If this is not the case, the triangle will be removed if is set to true.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_OG_EXCLUDE_LIST
member.summary:
Configures the step to preserve nodes matching a name in a given list. This is a list of 1 to n strings, whitespace ' ' serves as a delimter character. Identifiers containing whitespaces must be enclosed in *single* quotation marks. Carriage returns and tabs are treated as white space.
If a node matches one of these names, it will not be modified or removed by the postprocessing step.
Type: string. Default: ""

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_SLM_TRIANGLE_LIMIT
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of triangles a mesh can contain. This is used by the step to determine whether a mesh must be split or not.
Type: int. Default: AiDefines.AI_SLM_DEFAULT_MAX_TRIANGLES

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_SLM_VERTEX_LIMIT
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of vertices in a mesh. This is used by the step to determine whether a mesh must be split or not.
Type: integer. Default: AiDefines.AI_SLM_DEFAULT_MAX_VERTICES

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_LBW_MAX_WEIGHTS
member.summary:
Sets the maximum number of bones that can affect a single vertex. This is used by the step.
Type: integer. Default: AiDefines.AI_LBW_MAX_WEIGHTS

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_ICL_PTCACHE_SIZE
member.summary:
Sets the size of the post-transform vertex cache to optimize vertices for. This is for the step. The size is given in vertices. Of course you can't know how the vertex format will exactly look like after the import returns, but you can still guess what your meshes will probably have. The default value *has* resulted in slight performance improvements for most Nvidia/AMD cards since 2002.
Type: integer. Default: AiDefines.PP_ICL_PTCACHE_SIZE

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_RVC_FLAGS
member.summary:
Input parameter to the step. It specifies the parts of the data structure to be removed.
This is a bitwise combination of the flag. If no valid mesh is remaining after the step is executed, the import FAILS.
Type: integer. Default: 0

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_SBP_REMOVE
member.summary:
Input parameter to the step. It specifies which primitive types are to be removed by the step.
This is a bitwise combination of the flag. Specifying ALL types is illegal.
Type: integer. Default: 0

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_FID_ANIM_ACCURACY
member.summary:
Input parameter to the step. It specifies the floating point accuracy for animation values, specifically the epislon during the comparison. The step checks for animation tracks where all frame values are absolutely equal and removes them. Two floats are considered equal if the invariant abs(n0-n1) > epislon holds true for all vector/quaternion components.
Type: float. Default: 0.0f (comparisons are exact)

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_FID_IGNORE_TEXTURECOORDS
member.summary:
Input parameter to the step. Set to true to ignore texture coordinates. This may be useful if you have to assign different kinds of textures, like seasonally variable ones - one for summer and one for winter.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_TUV_EVALUATE
member.summary:
Input parameter to the step. It specifies which UV transformations are to be evaluated.
This is bitwise combination of the flag.
Type: integer. Default: AiDefines.AI_UV_TRAFO_ALL (All combinations)

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_FAVOUR_SPEED
member.summary:
A hint to Assimp to favour speed against import quality. Enabling this option may result in faster loading, or it may not. It is just a hint to loaders and post-processing steps to use faster code paths if possible. A value not equal to zero stands for true.
Type: integer. Default: 0

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_SBBC_MAX_BONES
member.summary:
Maximum bone cone per mesh for the step. Meshes are split until the max number of bones is reached.
Type: integer. Default: 60

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_CT_TEXTURE_CHANNEL_INDEX
member.summary:
Source UV channel for tangent space computation. The specified channel must exist or an error will be raised.
Type: integer. Default: 0

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_DB_THRESHOLD
member.summary:
Threshold used to determine if a bone is kept or removed during the step.
Type: float. Default: 1.0f

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_DB_ALL_OR_NONE
member.summary:
Require all bones to qualify for deboning before any are removed.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_PTV_ADD_ROOT_TRANSFORMATION
member.summary:
Configures the step to use a user defined matrix as the scene root node transformation before transforming vertices.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_PP_PTV_ROOT_TRANSFORMATION
member.summary:
Configures the step to use a user defined matrix as the scene root node transformation before transforming vertices.
Type: Matrix4x4. Default: Identity Matrix

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_GLOBAL_SCALE_FACTOR_KEY
member.summary:
Configures the step to scale the entire scene by a certain amount. Some importers provide a mechanism to define a scaling unit for the model, which this processing step can utilize.
Type: Float. Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_APP_SCALE_KEY
member.summary:
Applies application-specific scale to the global scale factor to allow for backwards compatibility.
Type: Float. Default: 1.0f.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_GLOBAL_KEYFRAME
member.summary:
Sets the vertex animation keyframe to be imported. Assimp does not support vertex keyframes (only bone animation is supported). The libary reads only one frame of models with vertex animations. By default this is the first frame.
The default value is 0. This option applies to all importers. However, it is also possible to override the global setting for a specific loader. You can use the AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_XXX_KEYFRAME options where XXX is a placeholder for the file format which you want to override the global setting.
Type: integer. Default: 0

member.summary: See the documentation for .

member.summary: See the documentation for .

member.summary: See the documentation for .

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_MDC_KEYFRAME
member.summary: See the documentation for .

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_SMD_KEYFRAME
member.summary: See the documentation for .

member.summary: See the documentation for .

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_AC_SEPARATE_BFCULL
member.summary:
Configures the AC loader to collect all surfaces which have the "Backface cull" flag set in separate meshes.
Type: bool. Default: true

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_AC_EVAL_SUBDIVISION
member.summary:
Configures whether the AC loader evaluates subdivision surfaces (indicated by the presence of the 'subdiv' attribute in the file). By default, Assimp performs the subdivision using the standard Catmull-Clark algorithm.
Type: bool. Default: true

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_UNREAL_HANDLE_FLAGS
member.summary:
Configures the UNREAL 3D loader to separate faces with different surface flags (e.g. two-sided vs single-sided).
Type: bool. Default: true

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_TER_MAKE_UVS
member.summary:
Configures the terragen import plugin to compute UV's for terrains, if they are not given. Furthermore, a default texture is assigned.
UV coordinates for terrains are so simple to compute that you'll usually want to compute them on your own, if you need them. This option is intended for model viewers which want to offer an easy way to apply textures to terrains.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_ASE_RECONSTRUCT_NORMALS
member.summary:
Configures the ASE loader to always reconstruct normal vectors basing on the smoothing groups loaded from the file. Some ASE files carry invalid normals, others don't.
Type: bool. Default: true

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_MD3_HANDLE_MULTIPART
member.summary:
Configures the M3D loader to detect and process multi-part Quake player models. These models usually consit of three files, lower.md3, upper.md3 and head.md3. If this propery is set to true, Assimp will try to load and combine all three files if one of them is loaded.
Type: bool. Default: true

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_MD3_SKIN_NAME
member.summary:
Tells the MD3 loader which skin files to load. When loading MD3 files, Assimp checks whether a file named "md3_file_name"_"skin_name".skin exists. These files are used by Quake III to be able to assign different skins (e.g. red and blue team) to models. 'default', 'red', 'blue' are typical skin names.
Type: string. Default: "default"

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_MD3_SHADER_SRC
member.summary:
Specifies the Quake 3 shader file to be used for a particular MD3 file. This can be a full path or relative to where all MD3 shaders reside.
Type: string. Default: ""

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_LWO_ONE_LAYER_ONLY
member.summary:
Configures the LWO loader to load just one layer from the model.
LWO files consist of layers and in some cases it could be useful to load only one of them. This property can be either a string - which specifies the name of the layer - or an integer - the index of the layer. If the property is not set then the whole LWO model is loaded. Loading fails if the requested layer is not vailable. The layer index is zero-based and the layer name may not be empty
Type: bool. Default: false (All layers are loaded)

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_MD5_NO_ANIM_AUTOLOAD
member.summary:
Configures the MD5 loader to not load the MD5ANIM file for a MD5MESH file automatically.
The default strategy is to look for a file with the same name but with the MD5ANIm extension in the same directory. If it is found it is loaded and combined with the MD5MESH file. This configuration option can be used to disable this behavior.
Type: bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_LWS_ANIM_START
member.summary:
Defines the beginning of the time range for which the LWS loader evaluates animations and computes AiNodeAnim's.
Assimp provides full conversion of Lightwave's envelope system, including pre and post conditions. The loader computes linearly subsampled animation channels with the frame rate given in the LWS file. This property defines the start time.
Animation channels are only generated if a node has at least one envelope with more than one key assigned. This property is given in frames where '0' is the first. By default, if this property is not set, the importer takes the animation start from the input LWS file ('FirstFrame' line)
Type: integer. Default: taken from file

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_LWS_ANIM_END
member.summary:
Defines the ending of the time range for which the LWS loader evaluates animations and computes AiNodeAnim's.
Assimp provides full conversion of Lightwave's envelope system, including pre and post conditions. The loader computes linearly subsampled animation channels with the frame rate given in the LWS file. This property defines the end time.
Animation channels are only generated if a node has at least one envelope with more than one key assigned. This property is given in frames where '0' is the first. By default, if this property is not set, the importer takes the animation end from the input LWS file.
Type: integer. Default: taken from file

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_IRR_ANIM_FPS
member.summary:
Defines the output frame rate of the IRR loader.
IRR animations are difficult to convert for Assimp and there will always be a loss of quality. This setting defines how many keys per second are returned by the converter.
Type: integer. Default: 100

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_OGRE_MATERIAL_FILE
member.summary:
The Ogre importer will try to load this MaterialFile. Ogre meshes reference with material names, this does not tell Assimp where the file is located. Assimp will try to find the source file in the following order: [material-name].material, [mesh-filename-base].material, and lastly the material name defined by this config property.
Type: string. Default: "Scene.Material"

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_OGRE_TEXTURETYPE_FROM_FILENAME
member.summary:
The Ogre importer will detect the texture usage from the filename. Normally a texture is loaded as a color map, if no target is specified in the material file. If this is enabled, then Assimp will try to detect the type from the texture filename postfix:
Normal Maps: _n, _nrm, _nrml, _normal, _normals, _normalmap
Specular Maps: _s, _spec, _specular, _specularmap
Light Maps: _l, _light, _lightmap, _occ, _occlusion
Displacement Maps: _dis, _displacement
The matching is case insensitive. Postfix is taken between the last "_" and last ".". The default behavior is to detect type from lower cased texture unit name by matching against: normalmap, specularmap, lightmap, and displacementmap. For both cases if no match is found then, is used.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_IFC_SKIP_SPACE_REPRESENTATIONS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the IFC loader skips over IfcSpace elements. IfcSpace elements (and their geometric representations) are used to represent free space in a building story.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_IFC_CUSTOM_TRIANGULATION
member.summary:
Specifies whether the IFC loader will use its own, custom triangulation algorithm to triangulate wall and floor meshes. If this is set to false, walls will be either triangulated by the post process triangulation or will be passed through as huge polygons with faked holes (e.g. holes that are connected with the outer boundary using a dummy edge). It is highly recommended to leave this property set to true as the default post process has some known issues with these kind of polygons.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_IFC_SMOOTHING_ANGLE
member.summary:
Specifies the tessellation conic angle for IFC smoothing curves. Accepted range of values is between [5, 120]
Type: Float. Default: 10.0f

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_IFC_CYLINDRICAL_TESSELLATION
member.summary:
Specifies the tessellation for IFC cylindrical shapes. E.g. the number of segments used to approximate a circle. Accepted range of values is between [3, 180].
Type: Integer. Default: 32

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_COLLADA_IGNORE_UP_DIRECTION
member.summary:
Specifies whether the collada loader will ignore the up direction.
Type: Bool. Default: false

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_COLLADA_USE_COLLADA_NAMES
member.summary:
Specifies whether the Collada loader should use Collada names as node names. If this property is set to true, the Collada names will be used as the node name. The default is to use the id tag (resp. sid tag, if no id tag is present) instead.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_ALL_GEOMETRY_LAYERS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will merge all geometry layers present in the source file or take only the first.
Type: bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_ALL_MATERIALS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will read all materials present in the source file or take only the referenced materials, if the importer will read materials, otherwise this has no effect.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_MATERIALS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will read materials.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_TEXTURES
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will read embedded textures.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_EMBEDDED_TEXTURES_LEGACY_NAMING
member.summary:
Specifies whether the fbx importer will use the legacy embedded texture naming.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_CAMERAS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will read cameras.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_LIGHTS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will read light sources.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_READ_ANIMATIONS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will read animations.
Type: Bool. default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_STRICT_MODE
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will act in strict mode in which only the FBX 2013 format is supported and any other sub formats are rejected. FBX 2013 is the primary target for the importer, so this format is best supported and well-tested.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_PRESERVE_PIVOTS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the FBX importer will preserve pivot points for transformations (as extra nodes). If set to false, pivots and offsets will be evaluated whenever possible.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_OPTIMIZE_EMPTY_ANIMATION_CURVES
member.summary:
Specifies whether the importer will drop empty animation curves or animation curves which match the bind pose transformation over their entire defined range.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_FBX_CONVERT_TO_M
member.summary:
Specifies whether the importer shall convert the unit from centimeter (cm) to meter (m).
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_FBX_IGNORE_UP_DIRECTION
member.summary:
Specifies whether the importer should ignore the embedded axis directions in the FBX file and load it as is.
Type: Bool. Default: false. Prior to Assimp v6.x.x the behavior was equivalent to the property being set to true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_SMD_LOAD_ANIMATION_LIST
member.summary:
Specifies whether the importer will load multiple animations.
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_IMPORT_REMOVE_EMPTY_BONES
member.summary:
Specifies whether the importer removes empty bones or not. Empty bones are often used to define connections for other models (e.g. attachment points).
Type: Bool. Default: true.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_EXPORT_XFILE_64BIT
member.summary:
Specifies if the X-file exporter should use 64-bit doubles rather than 32-bit floats.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: F:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiConfigs.AI_CONFIG_EXPORT_POINT_CLOUDS
member.summary:
Specifies whether the export should be able to export point clouds. When this flag is not defined the render data has to contain valid faces. Point clouds are only a collection of vertices which have no spatial organization by a face and the validation process will remove them. Enabling this feature will switch off the flag and enable the functionality to export pure point clouds.
Type: Bool. Default: false.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibrary.ExportSceneToBlob(System.IntPtr,System.String,Assimp.PostProcessSteps)
member.summary: Exports the given scene to a chosen file format. Returns the exported data as a binary blob which you can embed into another data structure or file.
member.param: Scene to export, it is the responsibility of the caller to free this when finished.
Format id describing which format to export to.
Pre processing flags to operate on the scene during the export.
member.returns: Exported binary blob, or null if there was an error.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibrary.ExportScene(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,Assimp.PostProcessSteps)
member.summary: Exports the given scene to a chosen file format and writes the result file(s) to disk.
member.param: The scene to export, which needs to be freed by the caller. The scene is expected to conform to Assimp's Importer output format. In short, this means the model data should use a right handed coordinate system, face winding should be counter clockwise, and the UV coordinate origin assumed to be upper left. If the input is different, specify the pre processing flags appropiately.
Format id describing which format to export to.

Pre processing flags - accepts any post processing step flag. In reality only a small subset are actually supported, e.g. to ensure the input conforms to the standard Assimp output format. Some may be redundant, such as triangulation, which some exporters may have to enforce due to the export format.
member.returns: Return code specifying if the operation was a success.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.AssimpLibrary.ExportScene(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,System.IntPtr,Assimp.PostProcessSteps)
member.summary: Exports the given scene to a chosen file format and writes the result file(s) to disk.
member.param: The scene to export, which needs to be freed by the caller. The scene is expected to conform to Assimp's Importer output format. In short, this means the model data should use a right handed coordinate system, face winding should be counter clockwise, and the UV coordinate origin assumed to be upper left. If the input is different, specify the pre processing flags appropiately.
Format id describing which format to export to.
Pointer to an instance of AiFileIO, a custom file IO system used to open the model and any associated file the loader needs to open, passing NULL uses the default implementation.

Pre processing flags - accepts any post processing step flag. In reality only a small subset are actually supported, e.g. to ensure the input conforms to the standard Assimp output format. Some may be redundant, such as triangulation, which some exporters may have to enforce due to the export format.
member.returns: Return code specifying if the operation was a success.

member.name: T:Assimp.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver
member.summary: Resolves unmanaged DLLs for . The process is completely configurable, where the user can supply alternative library names (e.g. versioned libs), an override library name, and probing paths. These can be set for both 32/64 bit, or seperately for 32 or 64 bit. See for the search strategy.

member.summary: Sets the collection of fallback library names (e.g. versioned libs) for 64-bit probing.

member.param: Null to clear, or set of paths to probe.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.SetOverrideLibraryName32(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an override 32-bit library name. By default, the implementations creates a default name for the library, which is passed into for resolving. If the override is non-null, it will be used instead. This is useful if the library to be loaded is not conforming to the platform's default prefix/extension scheme (e.g. libXYZ.so on linux where "lib" is the prefix and ".so" the extension).
member.param: Null to clear, or override library name.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.SetOverrideLibraryName64(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an override 64-bit library name. By default, the implementations creates a default name for the library, which is passed into for resolving. If the override is non-null, it will be used instead. This is useful if the library to be loaded is not conforming to the platform's default prefix/extension scheme (e.g. libXYZ.so on linux where "lib" is the prefix and ".so" the extension).
member.param: Null to clear, or override library name.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.SetOverrideLibraryName(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an override 32-bit and 64-bit library name. By default, the implementations creates a default name for the library, which is passed into for resolving. If the override is non-null, it will be used instead. This is useful if the library to be loaded is not conforming to the platform's default prefix/extension scheme (e.g. libXYZ.so on linux where "lib" is the prefix and ".so" the extension).
member.param: Null to clear, or override library name.

member.name: M:Assimp.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.ResolveLibraryPath(System.String)
member.summary:
Given a library name, this function attempts to resolve the file path from which it can be loaded. Each step of the search strategy uses the fallback library names if the given name was not found in the current step. If the search is unsuccessfully, the library name is returned which means the OS will try and do its own search strategy when attempting to load the library (this is dependent on the OS). The search strategy is the following, in order of execution:
Search user-specified probing paths.
Search {AppBaseDirectory}/runtimes/{RID}/native/.
Search {AppBaseDirectory}/.
Search nuget package path, e.g. {UserProfile}/.nuget/packages/{PackageId}/{PackageVersion}/runtimes/{RID}/native/.
The search strategy gives priority to user-specified probing paths, then local paths to the application, then finally examining the global nuget cache. The RID is the Runtime Identifier based on the platform/architecture, see also Microsoft's RID Catalog.
member.param: Name of the library to attempt to resolve.
member.returns: Full file path to the library, or the file name if not found (e.g. "libXYZ.so").

member.name: T:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiFileWriteProc
member.summary: Callback delegate for a custom file system, to write to a file.
member.param: Char* pointer to data to write (casted from a void*)
Size of a single element in bytes to write
member.returns: Number of elements successfully written. Should be zero if either size or numElements is zero. May be less than numElements if an error occured.

member.name: T:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiFileReadProc
member.summary: Callback delegate for a custom file system, to read from a file.
member.param: Char* pointer that will store the data read (casted from a void*)
Size of a single element in bytes to read
member.returns: Number of elements succesfully read. Should be zero if either size or numElements is zero. May be less than numElements if end of file is encountered, or if an error occured.

member.name: T:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiFileTellProc
member.summary: Callback delegate for a custom file system, to tell offset/size information about the file.
member.returns: Returns the current file cursor or the file size in bytes. May be -1 if an error has occured.

member.summary: Callback delegate for a custom file system, to flush the contents of the file to the disk.

member.name: T:Assimp.Unmanaged.AiFileSeek
member.summary: Callback delegate for a custom file system, to set the current position of the file cursor.
member.returns: Returns success, if successful

member.param: Pointer to an AiFile instance that will be closed.
